{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3385027,"name":"jonathan","username":"Jonathan.D","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonathan.d/{size}/203007_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-12T21:05:29.590Z","cooked":"

My team previously had management difficulties regarding CNC users in our manufacture team. People worked ineffectively and there were many problems and wrecks of things related to the machine. These problems happened because too many people were allowed to use the machine and this created disorder and lack of seriousness. In the last season I was appointed to be the head of our CNC and all the manufacture in it, and to make sure that we don’t have future problems like before, I reduced the list of the allowed team members to use the CNC to a small group in order to avoid problems in manufacturing. We managed to produce at a high level and relatively we managed to produce all the parts on time, but it was very difficult, Because we were so few. With the new season coming , I’m trying to figure out what the ideal number of people are allowed to use machines like our CNC. I would like to know how you manage your CNC manufacturing in your team. Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-12T21:05:29.590Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":162,"reads":1142,"readers_count":1141,"score":1138.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"jonathan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61287,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 manufacture lead"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/1","custom_user_title":"5990 manufacture lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3385030,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-12T21:10:57.758Z","cooked":"
Jonathan.D:

These problems happened because too many people were allowed to use the machine and this created disorder and lack of seriousness.

I’m going to make one slight modification: "too many insufficiently trained people were allowed to use the machine.

If you’re using the CNC, you need to actually know how to use it, or be supervised by someone who does. Now that you have a small group that does know what they’re doing, have each of them grab a minion, and train that minion how to use the CNC properly. Preferably a minion from at least one grade younger… Once the minions are properly trained and can run solo, re-evaluate your group size. If it’s too large, then the next season grab fewer minions. If it’s too small, grab more minions. If it’s just right, grab just enough minions to replace departing members of the CNC group.

My team doesn’t put a hard limit on CNC operator numbers. But, we do try to make sure they know what they’re doing!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-12T21:10:57.758Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1111,"readers_count":1110,"score":987.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":65}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":49},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":65,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385032,"name":"jonathan","username":"Jonathan.D","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonathan.d/{size}/203007_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-12T21:13:31.737Z","cooked":"

Got it. Thanks for the help!!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-12T21:13:31.737Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1017,"readers_count":1016,"score":248.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"jonathan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61287,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 manufacture lead"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/3","custom_user_title":"5990 manufacture lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385054,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-12T22:47:15.637Z","cooked":"

Less about how many people are “allowed to use” the CNC we put a limit of how many people can be in a machine area at once.

Before we moved into our new lab we had taped out caution areas around each machine that only 2 or 3 people at a time (depending on machine) were allowed in at the same time. We don’t want people crowding around the machines, nor do we want people who shouldn’t touch it getting near it. Usually a “Supervisor” and “Trainee” is the two

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T00:01:03.875Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":930,"readers_count":929,"score":216.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/4","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385071,"name":"Dan","username":"theworkshope","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/theworkshope/{size}/194375_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-12T23:50:01.865Z","cooked":"

This should really be the protocol for any power tool, it’s just much more exaggerated with the CNC due to the duration of jobs and risks involved. You describe the process well!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-12T23:50:01.865Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":810,"readers_count":809,"score":227.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53412,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385099,"name":"Sean","username":"SeanCh7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanch7/{size}/193121_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T01:05:34.655Z","cooked":"

This year we’re planning to have 2 designated fabrication leads as opposed to previous seasons where we’ve had 2 general mechanical leads that handle everything from CAD to finished product. In terms of limiting people, I personally hope that anyone with an interest in manufacturing is able to run a CNC independently by the end of the season. Almost anyone is capable of running a machine with the right training, last season we had 7th graders running machines (with supervision obviously).

I don’t know how your team manages tasks, but we use a whiteboard with a magnet for every person. We write projects on the board along with a max number of people working on any given project, and you can’t put your magnet on anything that’s full.

I believe the biggest factor helping reduce lost time incidents and avoidable costs is training. We’re restructuring our training this year to be theory based so our operators are better able to avoid incidents, troubleshoot on their own, and operate more effectively. Ex. if an operator knows what it sounds like when you feed too fast, they can adjust before we break a tool.

For safety, we have custom polycarb enclosures, not anything fancy just PC cable tied to an aluminum extrusion frame. This ideally eliminates most safety concerns, but I’m also definitely stealing the tape idea from @kingc95 .

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T01:06:14.892Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":741,"readers_count":740,"score":208.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Sean","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58253,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2220 Captain"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/6","custom_user_title":"2220 Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385101,"name":"Totally out of touch","username":"AdamHeard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamheard/{size}/195262_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T01:24:37.547Z","cooked":"

Kind of a tangent but I’d say the risk with a CNC to the student itself is way lower than a drill press, chop saw, lathe or other spooky manual machine.

The risk to part or tool value could be higher on a CNC of course.

Just think we should be precise about type and magnitude of a risk we’re assessing.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T01:24:37.547Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":601,"readers_count":600,"score":460.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Totally out of touch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53412,"username":"theworkshope","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/theworkshope/{size}/194375_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":26}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3609,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":20},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":26,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385111,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T01:56:30.142Z","cooked":"

You can take it farther and use different colors of caution tape to mean different types of zones. Green and white was our safety area, yellow and black is a machine area limited to qualified and limited numbers of people. Red and white was a hazard area to avoid (electrical boxes for the large machine power). Again kind of a tagent from what OP was asking about.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T09:30:45.102Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":568,"readers_count":567,"score":163.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58253,"username":"SeanCh7","name":"Sean","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanch7/{size}/193121_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/8","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385113,"name":"Matthew K","username":"superdude311","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/superdude311/{size}/230653_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T02:06:08.095Z","cooked":"

Usually on our team of ~15 people, we have 1-2 people who know how to use the CNC. We don’t artificially limit this number, some people just want to do other things than watch a machine that operates itself. I was the CNC person my first year, then last year it was me and the captain and another guy, and now that guy is our main CNC guy who knows how to run everything (we switched to VCarve and I have no idea how it works anymore).

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T02:06:08.095Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":539,"readers_count":538,"score":137.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Matthew K","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"barn2robotics alumni"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/9","custom_user_title":"barn2robotics alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385115,"name":"Totally out of touch","username":"AdamHeard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamheard/{size}/195262_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T02:08:53.030Z","cooked":"

Another thing to consider is the overall pareto efficiency of the team. For a given team there is a maximum number of CNC operators that makes sense before it is a net negative on the team due to those talented people NOT doing something else.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T02:08:53.030Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":516,"readers_count":515,"score":263.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Totally out of touch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3609,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385117,"name":"Nyx","username":"gellnick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gellnick/{size}/172273_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T02:13:38.142Z","cooked":"

All of them, assuming they’re properly trained.
Safety is #1.
If someone’s trained in safety, and they’re causing problems, it may be time for a safety reminder presentation.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T02:13:38.142Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":496,"readers_count":495,"score":189.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Nyx","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29971,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Everything and nothing, all at the same time"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/11","custom_user_title":"Everything and nothing, all at the same time","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385120,"name":"Dan","username":"theworkshope","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/theworkshope/{size}/194375_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T02:20:01.748Z","cooked":"

By risk in this case I meant more material/financial assuming you’re at least working with an enclosure. Easy to mess up a lot of stock or even the machine itself if you’re not careful.

Years ago there was a day in the shop where I had students running two CNC mills, two CNC lathes, two CNC routers, and a laser all at the same time, totally proficiently. It was awesome.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T04:40:46.853Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":448,"readers_count":447,"score":134.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385198,"name":"Ankur Raghavan","username":"Ankur-Raghavan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ankur-raghavan/{size}/207141_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T12:36:37.779Z","cooked":"

We have a team of about 45 total. Out of that about 6-7 people were qualified to setup and start the cnc. We had an issue in build season where one person accidentally ran the cnc with settings for lexan on aluminum stock, which killed the router. To prevent this we require that all tool paths are checked by another person before starting it.

Once it is started almost anyone is allowed to watch over it and make sure it doesn’t mess up, as well as applying cutting oil for aluminum parts. We allow this because we have a fairly small shop so there is always a trained person within earshot of the cnc, and they can often recognize issues by hearing.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T12:36:37.779Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":402,"readers_count":401,"score":125.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Ankur Raghavan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50601,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5⁵-4⁴"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/14","custom_user_title":"5⁵-4⁴","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385210,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T13:07:24.235Z","cooked":"

What you want is anyone with the proper training and experience who is able to bring that to bear at the moment of operation. If someone successfully operated a machine in February, it does not mean they are ready to operate it in August. For someone with little experience, operating a machine last week does not necessarily mean they are ready to operate it this week.

The right number for a particular machine depends a lot on your fabrication load. You want enough people to be able to handle the load, but not so many that their intervals between using the machine are long enough for them to forget the details.

Having more than one person qualified on a machine is helpful. Students can consult each other and fill in knowledge gaps as needed. Be careful about allowing pairs to work simultaneously on a machine, though. For the right pair, productivity is high, mistakes are low, and they watch out for each others’ safety. For the wrong pair, their distracting conversation or just lack of coordinated effort increases mistakes and danger.

This is pretty much exactly how Citrus Circuits does things. The one addition I would mention is having a mentor involved to make sure any holes in the students knowledge is getting filled properly. It is important to have a long term guiding presence to ensure important institutional knowledge is be passed on and not accidentally forgotten.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T15:33:10.700Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":328,"readers_count":327,"score":95.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"Devin Castellucci","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1678 Fab Mentor and 5458 Tech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/16","custom_user_title":"1678 Fab Mentor and 5458 Tech Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385280,"name":"snichols","username":"snichols","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/d78d45/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T15:43:38.404Z","cooked":"

As lots of people have pointed out, it has more to do with the quantity and quality of training. But in my experience with a team of 20-30 members, 2-3 experts and 2-3 trainees worked pretty well. With 2 CNC routers, that was enough to keep the machines running pretty much continuously even with folks absent once in a while, and made sure there were new students training to take over when seniors graduate.

In addition to providing a lot of training, a major factor is making new machinists feel comfortable asking questions. In my experience most students need to be shown how to do a machine task at least 4-5 times before they feel confident with it, and if students who ask for the 4th time “how do I change the endmill?” gets teased, even gently, they often stop asking questions and start guessing. 95% of dangerous (to people and machines) errors can be traced back to “I wasn’t sure/it seemed a bit off but I decided to go ahead anyway”.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2024-05-13T15:43:38.404Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":327,"readers_count":326,"score":135.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466146,"topic_slug":"how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc","display_username":"snichols","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27696,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-many-team-members-do-you-think-should-be-allowed-to-use-machines-like-cnc/466146/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385341,"name":"Devin Castellucci","username":"RoboChair","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/robochair/{size}/161076_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-13T18:07:48.242Z","cooked":"

I make a very strong point every year to our students that our machines are very dangerous and are trying to maim and kill you and it is your job to make sure they are never in a position to follow through with that. I also make it clear that I care about things in a very specific priority.

I care about you first, then the machine, then the tooling, then the part.

I made it very clear to everyone that got to work on our brand new Haas CNC’s this year just how expensive they are and how quickly they are capable of killing themselves and just how expensive 3 seconds or less of inattention or carelessness can be. I’m proud to say we only lost a few endmills and taps, one probe tip, and a single hard jaw got nicked.

If you are ever unsure about something, even a little bit, I want my students asking each other or a mentor because everyone in the shop is learning. Ignorance is fine as long as everyone wants to work together to replace it with knowledge and understanding.

Yeah, I learned CNC over the summer and if I didn’t feel like I could ask questions I would be QUITE the expensive student. I asked the mentor teaching me to go through everything as a pre-checklist before I even started the machine for the first 10-20 times I ran it. Even now that I’ve done hundreds and hundreds of parts I still sometimes feel like I’m forgetting something, which makes me cautious. People wanting to get into CNC: we all were new at some point, and we all had the same questions, so don’t feel bad asking them.

To the OP, people have already given great advice, just make sure you’re able to teach them to be confident and it’ll all turn out great

RoboChair:

our machines are very dangerous and are trying to maim and kill you

There’s several ways to get the point across. A former mentor took the gory route and made a slideshow of injuries. It was rough. One set of images were of someone with their hoodie string pulled into a lathe and they got yanked into it. The scar images and the image of the hoodie wrapped around the lathe stock was enough to keep many students away from anything in build that season.

Do NOT go this route. You will have some traumatized students.
